title: Problems importing bookmarks backup
content: I have 3 laptops. I downloaded an app to enable me to switch between bookmark sets, which immediately messed up my bookmarks. My previous bookmarks are backed up both as html and as json, but importing the bookmarks has proved impossible, as all 3 Firefox installations freeze. I should explain that my bookmarks set is very large. Uninstalling and re-installing Firefox does not help, partly because Firefox only gives me the choice of importing bookmarks from other browsers such as Chrome, and not directly from backup. What to do?
creator: matthewmontagupollock

title: Data loss after update
content: I installed the last update, my bookmarks kept being here but all my add-on, website shortcuts and firefox settings got removed. I checked the profiles to see if it was just another profile that was created but after checking each profile that was available they were all with the defaults settings without shortcuts and without add-on. I cannot recall all the add-on and websites saved so it is very important for me to recover them. What can I do?
creator: julien.bernard.jb

title: Firefox shows blank white page for all tabs, unusable
content:
Referencing these threads: 1281774 1307368 1317055 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1333680 (I posted a reply to this thread, but I can't view it and the moderator has apparently closed it thinking this problem has gone away)

We can ascertain that NOTHING seems to help this condition. In fact these threads apply to me as Win 7 / 64 bit apply to me. This started probably about 1.5 years ago.

I too have this problem and yes, it is random. BUT once locked in with this condition, it may "get stuck" for another 5 attempts for the same link. BEST Example, I do surveys every Friday and Saturday night. I use my netscape (AOL) email account. At random, while clicking on the survey link the tab will come up blank and no matter what you do, you CANNOT get this tab to do ANYTHING. No reload, no clicking on a new bookmark, no clicking on home, or typing in the address bar and pressing enter on THAT particular tab. How often does it happen? Maybe 12 times a month (during survey time: maybe every other weekend).

One step further on this. My wife's account on the PC actually does this on a DAILY BASIS REPEATEDLY EVERY DAY when she opens FireFox. In her case, it can ONLY be solved by closing and reopening FireFox after waiting like...say...2 minutes after previously opening it? I have tried opening new tabs etc as mentioned above (including the old right clicky trick and using the "Open in new tab" function). Kinda silly when you have like 27 tabs of blankness. Considering it is her account on the Pc, ok, maybe the "refresh" function might work on her? BZZZT! Nope.

Current version. I can attest that a PC at my 2 jobs that both have Win 7 and at least one, if not both, have 64 bit versions and do NOT display this malady. Also, I did re-install FF about 2 years ago for some other problem. I just ran the troubleshooting more...no go. Per this lead, try https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/the-latest-supported-visual-c-downloads-2647da03-1eea-4433-9aff-95f26a218cc0... and guess what? No such help . Anyone have have something to kill this bug?
creator: metalman630

title: Using Bookmark Search Plus 2 - How to Question: How does one reorganize folders after searching for them and then finding them?
content:
Title: "Using Bookmark Search Plus 2 Extension"

How to Question: Once I found the "Bookmarks" and "Bookmark Folders" that I searched for, is there a way to reorganize them afterwards? I'm asking this question, because I would like to start cleaning up this mess of mine. It probably spans about 4 years worth of Bookmarks, so it would turn out to be useful (come in handy) to be able to regroup them as to keep things more tidy.

I'm still a "noob" using this amazing extension, so thanks for the understanding in advance. I uploaded an image to help illustrate what I'm asking.

So as a brief description, I entered the word "Screeps" on Bookmark Search Plus 2 extension in order to perform an extensive search of all my "Bookmark Folders" and "Bookmarks" that are related to that specific search keyword. And now that I found them, I would like to dump them all in a newly created folder, namely, "Screeps Master - 2021". However, I can't seem to drag and drop them on to a new folder location. If this extension doesn't offer this capability, is there another extension that perhaps allows this?

Any tips or suggestions are more than welcome, who knows, perhaps there's an even better solution that I didn't even think of, but which I'm more than open and willing to try out.
creator: christopherdoryan

title: How to delete form fill data?
content: Firefox enters old data on a website when i try to fill out a form. How do I delete this old data without deleting all form fill data?

title: Lost of passwords
content:
Firefox Browser 91.0.1 (64 bits) updated on August 17, 2021

DESKTOP-RMQPN98, Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8665U CPU @ 1.90GHz 2.11 GHz RAM 16,0 Go 2EA08739-3F4E-41FC-9C65-5F14D51A3A70 00326-10000-00000-AA107 64 bits

Windows 10 Famille, 20H2, Installed on 29/‎03/‎2021 OS Build 19042.1165 Windows Feature Experience Pack 120.2212.3530.0


Hello,

For 1 week, perhaps since August 17, 2021, all of my usernames, passwords and main password have frequently disappeared.

This morning I closed the browser and launched it again. I have, a priori, lost nothing.

I restarted the computer. Again, the usernames, passwords and master password were gone.

I didn't changed any settings before or after the last update.

Any solution ?

Regards.
creator: firefox1514

title: How to fix: primary password dialog box re-appears over and over again.
content:
after update to FF 91.0.1 (64 bit) on my Win7 laptop, the primary password dialog request re-appears over and over again (after I'm already signed in). It happens no matter what tab I'm on, and won't allow any other actions until I dismiss it. It actually won't even accept the password if entered.--the only way to dismiss it is click cancel or the X, but it just comes back again in a minute.

(This is not related at all to the problem I saw listed about password request if using eSet or AVG security)

title: I'm getting a "Access Denied" notice when I try to log into an account.  Just started happening.
content: It just started. The last time I did log into the account was Last month. Had no problem at all. This is a table top Dell Inspiron 3253, Win 10, firefox. Running Win defender and firewall. I did try logging in with Edge, and could get on without a problem. On another computer, Asus X55a, laptop, Win 8.1, firefox, same DSL cable. I can log in with no problem. So must be something with firefox. I have it set to auto-download any updates. I know there was one because it loaded when I turned on the computer a few days ago. I have cleared the cookies and cache. I have the same setting in both computers. I did run a DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth, to see if anything was wrong. Nothing. I'm not very good with the technical part of computers and language. So many suggestions I've found are way over my head. Pleas help me.
